And I want to talk about and update to one of yesterdays big stories
And that is the Gabbie Show  Ricegum situation
There is a lot of confusion, misinformation and seemingly more and more lies being thrown around
And so I want to address this, if you a want to deep dive of the accusations that were made
Go watch yesterday's video, if you haven't, I'll try to oversimplify to bring you up to speed
Gabbie and Rice are massive creators on this site
Rice made a video bashing and making fun of Gabbie
It got over 7 million views
Made fun of everything from her content, her personality, her appeareance
So then the other night Gabbie realizes they're at the same party
She's snapchatting the whole thing
She says I'm gonna go up to him. She snapchats herself "challenging" him
but really just giving him crap. He says he asked her not to post those
she posted those. And the next thing we know we have Gabbie posting a snapchat where she says
Ricegum didn't think that joke was very funny and
he hit me in the middle of a party and shattered my phone
And the word hit here is a key point because that is one of the main points being debated
On the same string of snapchats Gabbie goes on to clarify
when I say hit I'm not saying that he beat the shit out of me
that he punched me in the face, he grabbed me, twisted my arm
my phone away, he took it, he smashed it, destroying my property
The thing that even as of posting the video we knew was true
because Ricegum then sent her money to pay for the phone
I reached out to both of them, Gabbie responded Ricegum did not and has still not.
Although he did publicly on his twitter did deny hitting her
And then separate from that he did several interviews, and the information seems to conflict with reality and so I want to jump into that
When Ricegum was being interviewed, his main point was to focus on the word 'hit'
because that's the first word Gabbie used so he keeps repeating it over and over again
he's trying to defend this argument that she clarifies on later. It keeps sounding like he's trying to build up on it
Rice: she said I hit her as if I like, put her down (lauging) she said I hit her like I fucking like
But all that appears to be is Ricegum making a straw man. Gabbie once again in her snapchat says
Like assaulting me I guess is the word, um.. he didn't like beat the shit out of me if that is the impression you guys are gett--
But he grabbed me like twisted my arm, I think I said that, and like held me down, and I have like those scratches up here and on
my wrists and arm and like I had a big scratch on my leg
So he's arguing against a thing that is not the main point. He says oh she is trying to say
I made those bruises on her legs. No in Gabbie's video where she was trying to show injuries, she was showing scratch marks
Even before these videos went out Gabbie clarified to me "I'm not talking about those bruises, those scars, I'm talking about the scratches"
Once again strawman. And then when Ricegum was asked well about those scratches he says "I-It is not possible."
Rice: Bro I don't even have nails --
I don't even have nails to do that, but then he took to twitter and posted a video of him scratching himself with his hands
Not only showing that he could have in fact inflicted those scratches through some sort of tussle
But alleging that Gabbie self harmed to frame him.
And he would later go on to delete that video but other people kept it up including Gabbie herself
But then we get an eye witness account from someone that says they were at the party from another creator by the name of Romeo LaCoste
Or LeCost -- I'm sorry if I misprounounce your last name
just to prevent further mispronunciation of your name I'm just gonna call you tattoo neck
Not a bash, nice ink
he says Ricegum didn't really hit her it was more
she's sitting on the couch, he's standing up
and it was more of like a tug of war
you know them pulling the phone back and forth, maybe for a few seconds
and then he snatched the phone out of her hand and slammed it on the ground
and broke the phone and then walked out
ummm.. was he being aggressive? Yes definitely, definitely more aggressive than he should have been
um for the situation, did I see him hit her?
definitely not.

on the word hit as in punch
Gabbie clarifies in her string of snapchats that he grabbed her
got on top of her, which sounds like he was standing up, she was on the couch

eh that does suck, if the, if the people think that you hit women

and you can stay out of my body as well

the Blaze owns it

there's no doubt in my mind either Tomi Lahren starts up her own venture or she ends somewhere mainstream
and of course there were people angry and celebrating this news as well
she's a very polarizing person

this is not bad news for Tomi Lahren
Tomi Lahren not having access to her page is just more promotion for her
what's the Blaze gonna do with that channel?
are they going to rebrand it and all of Tomi Lahren's fans are just gonna be completely fine with it?
the best thing they could do in that situation is try to pawn it off to someone else that's stupid enough to buy it
or just not do anything with it and avoid the horrible PR they would receive

example - I have 5+ million subscribers on YouTube, and my videos get a million views
my channel's existed for 10 years, a majority of those are probably not active
but those ones that are active, once Tomi launches her new thing, they're gonna come in a hoard
social media's gonna blow up about it, she'll probably gain new viewers she would not've gained otherwise
and that is because audiences are loyal to people, not brands
whether it be with the Tomi Lahren's of the world

but Donald Tump was also in the news for a more real reason
and that's because this morning, it appears that he is ready to with war with part of his own party
tweeting
"The Freedom Caucas will hurt the entire Republicin agenda if the don't get on the team & fast. We must fight them & Dems, in 2018!"
now if you don't know what the Freedom Caucus is
it's around 30 Republicans that are in the House
they're seen as sympathetic to the Tea Party, Right, to far Right
and more recently they were one of the main opponents to the American Health Care Act
they of course weren't the only opposition, but many have blamed them or thanked them
so there were some cheering Donald Trump on, of not being scared to bash people in his own party
others bashing Trump because he's talking about party over politics
but a thing I wanna point out is I don't really know if there's much they can do to hurt the Freedom Caucas
thanks very much to gerrymandering that happened back in 2010
I'm gonna oversimplify this, but it's the changing of congressional districts to try and pull out a winner
where there previously might have been a more competitive race
both Democrats and Republicans have been guilty of gerrymandering, but the Republicans did an amazing job  in 2010
many attribute it to that specifically of why we've seen Congress swing so much to the red
the past 7 years
so, in certain places like North Carolina, where there would've been a more competitive race
thanks to the way the district is set up, people like Mark Meadows, who is a Republican in North Carolina
was part of the Freedom Caucus, he's an example of someone that looks invulnerable
he won his last election 230,000 votes to 129,000  votes
and you look at the other members of the Freedom Caucus and many fit this same description
they are safe Republicans
Moe Brooks of Alabama won 205,000 to 102,000
when he had to fight off a fellow Republican in 2014
he won with 80% of the vote
a lot of these guys can just do whatever they want and not toe party lines
so if Trump is going to villainize these members of his same party, he has a long fight ahead of him
and so for me personally, the most interesting place in politics right now
isn't at the executive level
it is in the House
can a president with his current approval ratings really threaten the Freedom Caucus who are winning by landslides?
and what do other House Republicans do, do they stand by and back Donald Trump's words?
or do they say 'woah, you're overstepping, we're all a part of the same party'?
and of course, you'll have the 2018 eleciton that just, that could shake everything up
as far as legislation being passed or shut down
